abstract: Op-Ed article by international journalism Prof Alexander Stille examines the seeming paradoxical trends of rising equality for once dispossessed groups like women and minorities and rising income equality in America; argues that reducing discrimination seems to have made it easier to justify disproportionately rewarding the elite.
snippet: In economic terms, the United States has gone from being a comparatively egalitarian society to one of the most unequal democracies in the world.
lead_paragraph: In economic terms, the United States has gone from being a comparatively egalitarian society to one of the most unequal democracies in the world.

headline.main: The Paradox of the New Elite
headline.print_headline: The Paradox Of the New Elite
headline.seo: Social Inequality and the New Elite
